Tras crear el diagrama en dbdiagram.

selecionamos export postgresSQL y al descargar el achivo lo abrimos en el navegador, copiamos la ruta.
Abrimos psql \c nombre de database y al estar conectado pegamos la ruta del navegador (ejemplo: /Users/brandon/Downloads/Untitled.sql)
De esa forma se crea automaticamente la database.










CREATE TABLE "car_model" (
  "id" INT GENERATED BY DEFAULT AS IDENTITY PRIMARY KEY,   <--- generador de id autoincrementable
  "model" varchar(25) UNIQUE NOT NULL,
  "brand" varchar(25) NOT NULL
);

CREATE TABLE "transmition" (
  "id" INT GENERATED BY DEFAULT AS IDENTITY PRIMARY KEY,
  "type" varchar(20) NOT NULL
);

CREATE TABLE "brand" (
  "id" INT GENERATED BY DEFAULT AS IDENTITY PRIMARY KEY,
  "name" varchar(25) NOT NULL,
  "country" int NOT NULL
);

CREATE TABLE "country" (
  "id" INT GENERATED BY DEFAULT AS IDENTITY PRIMARY KEY,
  "name" varchar(25) NOT NULL
);

CREATE TABLE "car_transmition" (
  "id" INT GENERATED BY DEFAULT AS IDENTITY PRIMARY KEY,
  "model" int NOT NULL,
  "type" int NOT NULL
);

ALTER TABLE "car_model" ADD FOREIGN KEY ("brand") REFERENCES "brand" ("id");

ALTER TABLE "brand" ADD FOREIGN KEY ("country") REFERENCES "country" ("id");

ALTER TABLE "car_transmition" ADD FOREIGN KEY ("model") REFERENCES "car_model" ("id");

ALTER TABLE "car_transmition" ADD FOREIGN KEY ("type") REFERENCES "transmition" ("id");






======================================== AGREGAR VALORES A TABLA CREADA ====================

postgres=# \c models
Ahora está conectado a la base de datos «models» con el usuario «postgres».
models=# \dt
            Listado de relaciones
 Esquema |     Nombre      | Tipo  |  Due±o
---------+-----------------+-------+----------
 public  | brand           | tabla | postgres
 public  | car_model       | tabla | postgres
 public  | car_transmition | tabla | postgres
 public  | country         | tabla | postgres
 public  | transmition     | tabla | postgres
(5 filas)


models=# SELECT * FROM country
models-# SELECT * FROM country;
ERROR:  error de sintaxis en o cerca de «SELECT»
LINEA 2: SELECT * FROM country;
         ^
models=# SELECT * FROM country;
 id |  name
----+--------
  1 | Japon
  2 | EUA
  3 | Italia
(3 filas)


models=# INSERT INTO brand (name,country) VALUES ('Susuki',1),('Chevrolet',2),('Fiat',3);
INSERT 0 3
models=# SELECT * FROM brand;
 id |   name    | country
----+-----------+---------
  1 | Susuki    |       1
  2 | Chevrolet |       2
  3 | Fiat      |       3
(3 filas)


INSERT INTO model_car(model,brand) VALUES ('swift',1),('baleno',1),('ertiga',1),('beat',2),('blazer,2),('aveo',2),('onix',2),('mobi',3),('argo',3), ('pulse',3);

INSERT INTO car_transmition (model,type) VALUES
models-# (1,1),
models-# (1,2),
models-# (2,1),
models-# (2,2),
models-# (3,2),
models-# (4,2),
models-# (5,1),
models-# (5,2),
models-# (6,1),
models-# (6,2),
models-# (7,1),
models-# (8,1),
models-# (8,2),
models-# (9,1),
models-# (9,2),
models-# (10,1),
models-# (10,2);



========================================== Unir dos tablas.


SE LEEE: seleccionar todo de la tabla car_model y unirla a brand DONDE car_model.brand es = brand.id.

models=# SELECT * FROM car_model JOIN brand ON car_model.brand=brand.id;

Seleccionando solo tablas especificas.



Se lee: SELECCIONA "user.id users.id, users.name, roles.level" DE users UNIDO roles DONDE users.roles=roles.id

SELECT users.id, users.name, roles.level FROM users JOIN roles ON users.roles=roles.id;



SELECCIONANDO SOLO UNA FILA CON VALORES DE AMBAS TABLAS.
Se lee: SELECCIONA "user.id users.id, users.name, roles.level" DE users UNIDO roles DONDE users.roles=roles.id donde users.name='Brandon';
cursos=# SELECT users.id, users.name, roles.level FROM users JOIN roles ON users.roles=roles.id WHERE users.name='Brandon';
